title: 10 Easy Ways To Cut Sugar From Your Diet
summary: If you’re constantly craving sugar, try adding some more fiber to your diet. Eat more fruits, vegetables and whole grains, and drink lots of water. Read the labels on everything you eat, so be aware of hidden sugars. Watch out for these sneaky names for sugar: high fructose corn syrup, corn syrup,. dextrose, glucose, sucrose. Don’t go Hungry: If an item is adulterated, it has been contaminated by something foreign a chemical. If you like sweet coffee, consider mixing in some artificial sweeteners or sugar substitutes.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In recent years, sugar has received a lot of negative attention. From the link between sugar and obesity to the prevalence of diabetes, research on sugar and its potential health effects continues to grow.
There are many different types of sugars out there, but common table sugar or sucrose is the one you need to cut back on. Eating too much sugar can lead to weight gain, high blood pressure and other health problems. If you\u2019ve read any articles about how bad sugar is for you, then you probably already know this. However, cutting back on sugar isn\u2019t always easy. Sugar is in almost everything! Luckily, we\u2019ve compiled a list of 10 super helpful tips that will teach you how to cut back on your intake of this not-so-nice white substance\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Change what\u2019s in your coffee"),mdx("p",null,`Coffee is a great source of antioxidants, and it can be a healthy beverage. But if you\u2019re adding sugar or milk to your coffee, you\u2019re basically negating the health benefits. Studies suggest that milk has a negative effect on blood pressure, which is bad for your heart. So if you\u2019re drinking coffee, try to leave the milk out!
There are also lots of different types of coffee with different flavors that don\u2019t have any added sugar. So if you\u2019re craving a specific flavor, like pumpkin spice or a mocha, look for one that doesn\u2019t have any added sugar. If you like sweet coffee, consider mixing in some artificial sweeteners or sugar substitutes instead.`),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t go Hungry"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re constantly feeling hungry, you might be eating too many sugary foods. Most people eat when they\u2019re stressed, bored or tired, not necessarily because they\u2019re hungry. So if you\u2019re constantly eating just because, you might want to make a conscious effort to stop and ask yourself if you\u2019re actually hungry.
If you\u2019re trying to cut back on sugar, try eating smaller meals throughout the day, instead of three big meals. Eating four or five small meals throughout the day will help keep your blood sugar levels steady, which can reduce cravings.
Try incorporating protein into each meal to curb your sugar cravings.`),mdx("h2",null,"Eat the good stuff first"),mdx("p",null,`This may sound silly, but it makes a huge difference. If you eat fruits and vegetables first, you\u2019ll be less hungry for the sugary stuff. You can also try to eat more fiber, which can help curb your sugar cravings.
If you\u2019re constantly craving sugar, try adding some more fiber to your diet. Eat more fruits, vegetables and whole grains, and drink lots of water.
If you\u2019re constantly craving sugar, try adding some more fiber to your diet. Eat more fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, and drink lots of water. Water can help flush out your system and keep you feeling full.`),mdx("h2",null,"Learn to read labels"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re trying to cut back on sugar, it\u2019s important to read the labels on everything you eat. This will give you a good idea of what\u2019s in your food, and where the sugar is coming from.
If you\u2019re buying processed foods, many times you won\u2019t find the word \u201Csugar\u201D on the ingredients list. Look out for these sneaky names for sugar:
Additives: high fructose corn syrup, corn syrup, dextrose, glucose, sucrose
Natural Flavors: cane juice`),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t be afraid of the dark (or green) places"),mdx("p",null,`Dark and green leafy vegetables have very little sugar, if any at all. Try to eat more leafy greens like spinach and kale, as well as broccoli and cauliflower. You can also try eating more tomatoes, peppers, and eggplants. They\u2019re great sources of lycopene, which has been shown to reduce the risk of heart disease.
You can also try drinking lots of tea, especially green and black tea. Tea is a great source of antioxidants. Tomatoes and tea are two of the best sources of lycopene.`),mdx("h2",null,"Be aware of hidden sugars"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re trying to cut back on sugar, it\u2019s important to be aware of hidden sugars. You\u2019ll find sugar in places you wouldn\u2019t expect, such as bread, crackers, meat, and even some beer!
If you\u2019re eating out, you can use the My Food Monster app to scan the menu and find out how much sugar is in the dishes. If you\u2019re baking, try to use natural sweeteners like dates and honey instead of sugar.`),mdx("h2",null,"Watch out for these words"),mdx("p",null,"Sugar is often disguised as different words, so be on the lookout for these:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Adulterated: If an item is adulterated, it has been contaminated by something foreign to it, typically a chemical. This can include sugar that has been mixed with corn syrup or other non-sugar ingredients.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Natural: This doesn't necessarily mean that there's no sugar in the food. It just means that the food item has not been processed. Since sugar cane is a natural product, sugar can be described as natural.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Fresh: This word is often used to describe foods that are refrigerated, including dairy products and bread. Fresh bread and dairy products often contain sugar.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Reduced/Less: Food items that have less of something have been processed to remove that something. For example, reduced fat peanut butter contains less fat (and usually more sugar) than regular peanut butter."))),mdx("h2",null,"Commit to a few days of no sugar"),mdx("p",null,"This can be a great way to reset your cravings and make a conscious effort to avoid added sugars. When you\u2019re craving something sweet, eat something nutritious like fruit or vegetables instead."),mdx("p",null,"After a few days, your cravings will be gone, and you\u2019ll be able to make better decisions about what you should and shouldn\u2019t be eating."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re having a difficult time cutting back on sugar, try one of these tips. There are lots of different ways to reduce your sugar intake without having to give up the things you love. A few small changes can make a big difference when it comes to how much sugar you\u2019re consuming. With a few simple adjustments, you\u2019ll be well on your way to a healthier lifestyle."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Eat Healthy on a Busy Schedule

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Eating healthy on a busy schedule is no easy task. It\u2019s not like we all have hours to cook and prep the perfect meal after a long day at school or work. So how are we supposed to eat right when there\u2019s barely time to even pick up fast food? Well, the answer isn\u2019t as hard as you might think\u2026 If you are ready to take control of your diet, then read on\u2026
If you feel like your life is always in hyper-speed and there\u2019s never enough hours in the day to get everything done, then you know exactly how these pressures can lead to unhealthy eating habits. But that doesn\u2019t have to be the case forever. Even with a busy schedule, it is totally possible for anyone to eat healthy meals regularly.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Get Fit without a Gym Membership

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s fast-paced society, most of us struggle to find time to exercise. While it\u2019s easy to overlook the benefits of exercising when you have a packed day, staying active can have a positive impact on your life. The American Council on Exercise states that being active has been proven as beneficial for mental and physical health as well as quality of life. The following are 5 ways to get fit without a gym membership.
With the rise in popularity of home gyms and personal training, more people than ever before are getting fit without stepping foot into a gym. In this article, we explore five ways you can get fit without joining a gym or purchasing an expensive home setup. Whether you have a small apartment or live in an area with limited outdoor activities, there are many different ways you can stay active and get fit without spending money on a gym membership or personal trainer.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Regular Exercise - And How to Get Started

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Getting into a regular workout routine is something that\u2019s a lot easier said than done for most people. While some of us have it easier than others when it comes to fitting fitness into our busy lives, we all struggle with different things at one point or another. It\u2019s easy to let other responsibilities fall by the wayside and not get moving, so you need to be strategic about how and when you work out. While there are many different benefits to exercise, the biggest thing that it has to offer is stress reduction. If you\u2019re looking for ways to reduce your stress in your everyday life, adding exercise to your routine is a great place to start. Here are some reasons why getting your sweat on regularly could be exactly what you need right now:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Exercises You Can Do at Home and save a Ton of Money

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Who says working out has to be expensive? You can do it anywhere and anytime. There are various affordable home workout videos available on the internet as well. However, that doesn\u2019t mean you have to break the bank when trying to save money in other areas of your life. Those at-home videos might seem like your only cheap option, but there are plenty of ways you can cut down on costs while still getting the same benefits from working out at home.
Instead of splurging on a one-time membership or an expensive series of DVDs, why not invest in some home equipment that won\u2019t cost you a fortune, but will help you get in great shape? Working out at home also has its advantages: no traffic jams and no gym membership fees! Here are 10 cheap home workout ideas for anyone who wants to slim down and tone up without breaking their budget.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 8 Ways to Make Healthy Eating More Exciting

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s world, it\u2019s not easy to stick to healthy eating habits. Everywhere you look there are temptations that make it difficult to eat the right things. However, with the right approach and mindset, healthy eating doesn\u2019t have to be boring or restrictive. You just need a bit of inspiration and ideas on how to make healthy eating exciting again. Eating well doesn\u2019t need to be dull or uninteresting \u2013 in fact, it can be quite the opposite if you bring your A-game to the table.
If you\u2019re struggling with making healthy eating more exciting, here are some ways that can help get you back on track so you can enjoy great food while still feeling good about what you\u2019re putting in your body.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: A Beginner's Guide to Meditation and Its Benefits

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The idea of sitting still and focusing on your breathing might sound a bit too challenging at first, but meditation is actually much simpler than you might think. If you\u2019ve been struggling to find balance in your life and keep your stress levels under control, meditation is just what you need. As we go through this hectic world, our minds are constantly racing from one thought to another without even noticing. Most of us have a hard time dealing with the pressures of everyday life, which is why meditation can be such a great tool for clearing our mind and finding peace once again. It also helps reduce stress, lift our mood, increase self-awareness and make us more compassionate human beings. So if you\u2019re ready to adopt the practice of meditation in your life on a regular basis, read on \u2013 we\u2019ve got all the details you need!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Healthy Diet - And How to Stick to It

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`A healthy diet is a significant part of any healthy lifestyle. It\u2019s also one of the most difficult to maintain. With all the tempting fast food, vending machine snacks, and restaurants with cheap but high-calorie meals, it\u2019s not easy to eat right. Luckily, there are plenty of ways to make sticking to a healthy diet easier.
If you want to improve your health, increase your energy, and lose weight\u2014while still enjoying great food\u2014a healthy diet is the way to do it. A healthy diet can help prevent disease and keep you feeling great. Following these tips can get you well on your way towards meeting your nutrition goals and eating a balanced diet that will keep you happy and healthy for life.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

7 Exercises to Lose Weight in 7 Days

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The beginning of the New Year is a perfect time to focus on healthy habits and get off to a great start. With a strict diet, you will be able to burn fat effectively and efficiently, leading to weight loss in just a week. Exercising regularly not only helps you lose weight but also promotes long-term weight loss by increasing your metabolic rate and maintaining lean body mass.
Reducing fat from the body requires breaking down of fats in the body through physical activities. There are undoubtedly many reasons why people fail at losing weight, but most of them boil down to three simple things: lack of time, motivation, or knowledge. Fortunately, with these simple tricks you can lose weight in 7 days:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
